questions.answer_description: In this case we have run the impdp without performing any conversion if endian format is different then we have to first perform conversion.

comments.content: Does that mean I need to 'alter database open read only' the source database for the data transfer?

discussion.content: If you read the command, you will see that it does not import data from any dumpfile. It does it through a network link, and it does not convert from endian format either. Is correct A, B, D

comments.content: It is extracting the data from data files rather than data dump files.

discussion.content: can you import on target database without export dump file?

choices.E: The impdp operation must be performed by the same user that performed the expdp operation.
choices.B: All the user-defined tablespaces must be in read-only mode on the source database.
choices.C: The export dump file must be created before starting the import on the target database.
choices.A: The import operation must be performed by a user on the target database by a user with the DATAPUMP_IMP_FULL_DATABASE role, and the database link must connect to a user with the DATAPUMP_EXP_FULL_DATABASE role on the source database.
choices.D: The source and target database must be running on the same operating system (OS) with the same endianness.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about Enterprise Manager Database Express? (Choose three.)

choices.D: It can use the HTTPS protocol.
choices.A: It can be used to perform database backup operations.
choices.E: It is available only when the database is open.
choices.B: It can use the HTTP protocol.
choices.C: The same port number is used for multiple Database Express configurations on the same host.
COLUMN STORE COMPRESS FOR ARCHIVE LOW

questions.question_text:
You want to create a table, DAILY_ORDERS, for an OLTP application, where data should be compressed during both direct-path INSERT and conventional DML.
The table will also be used for queries.
Which compression option should be used?

discussion.content: When you enable table compression by specifying ROW STORE COMPRESS ADVANCED, you enable Advanced Row Compression. Oracle Database compresses data during all DML operations on the table. This form of compression is recommended for OLTP environments.

basic compression for direct-path insert operationes 10x
advance row compression for all DML operations 2 -4x
Answer: D

choices.C: Allocated and free extents are tracked using bitmaps.
choices.D: Segment free space is tracked in the data dictionary.
choices.B: The tablespace, TEST1, can contain a maximum of one data file.
choices.A: The data file, TEST01.DBF, can be auto extended to a maximum size of 5M.

discussion.content: Locally managed tablespaces track all extent information in the tablespace itself, using bitmaps

comments.content:
no, I change my mind. It should be C.
AUTOEXTEND ON UNIFORM means it will auto extend the file size

questions.question_text:
Examine the command:

SQL> CREATE TABLESPACE test1 -
DATAFILE '/u01/app/oracle/oradata/orc1/test01.dbf' SIZE 5M
AUTOEXTEND ON UNIFORM;
Which statement is true?

choices.D: They are terminated after completing the transaction.
choices.A: They are not terminated but may only issue queries.

questions.question_text:
Your database is open in read/write mode and multiple users are connected to the database instance.
You execute the following command:
SQL> ALTER SYSTEM ENABLE RESTRICTED SESSION;
What would be the effect on current sessions?

comments.content:
May be only in 11. Doc for 12.1 do not make difference between single instance and cluster:
https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/ADMIN/start.htm#ADMIN11155
(correct B)

discussion.content:
B if (and only) it is a single-instance environment 
https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E18283_01/server.112/e17120/start002.htm

Answer B: In a single-instance environment without Oracle Restart, no user sessions are terminated or otherwise affected. Therefore, after placing an instance in restricted mode, consider killing (terminating) all current user sessions before performing administrative tasks.
https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E18283_01/server.112/e17120/start002.htm#
